{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3485430,"name":"Matthew Milunic","username":"mathum","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/8baadc/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T04:40:28.212Z","cooked":"

We were getting some automated tag alignment and pose estimation working today, and for some reason using the latest limelight field map released (2025 r2) we were getting poses that were about 1.5 feet off when displayed in Advantage Scope. When we were directly in front of a reef april tag, the Limelight bot pose shown in the Limelight UI and the one we were displaying in Advantage Scope were exactly the same pose, but in the LL UI it showed the april tag pose as directly in front of the robot and offset by a meter in the Advantage Scope view.

Basically, I believe that the Limelight field map reef april tags are all off by about 1.5 feet. Manually modifying the map so they were all 1.5 feet farther from the centerline fixed our issues.

Hopefully if anyone else is having issues with this, this helps.

PS:
Let me know if I’m missing something and this isn’t a Limelight field map error.

Field Dimensions changed this year. Even though you may have uploaded the new field map, limelight’s field dimensions aren’t adjusted. Hence, some measurements seem inaccurate.

the new limelightOS image download will hopefully be released soon, so you can update the firmware, where 1. the 2025 field map will be default and 2. field dimensions will be fixed Software Change Log & Feedback | Limelight Documentation (we are waiting for the download of 2025.0 to come out)
